span.div: Clean Air Council is sponsoring a ReImagine Beaver County essay contest, open to highschool juniors and seniors in Beaver County, with support from ReImagine Beaver County,The Climate Reality Project, and The League of WomenVoters of Pennsylvania Citizen Education Fund. Click the links below to access the requirements.
Submission Deadline Wednesday, June 3, 2020
The BVIU continues to offer virtual sessions for Parents. Check out the latest presentation on Google Classroom Basics:

h3.a: YAP Update - Beaver County System of Care

span.div: The Aliquippa Youth Ambassadors work to make a change in the future of their community, their friends, and themselves. The youth will always be the future. What will your future look like? Start making a positive change today for a better tomorrow.

All of our teachers are working hard to provide online instruction and are available from 10:00 AM - 2:00 PM during regular school days. We will do everything we can to provide educational resources and new ways for teachers and students to connect, but learning requires structure andconsistency. Make sure to take time to learn everyday and help students grow.
Please view the letter from ourSuperintendent of Schools below for more information:

h3.a: School Closure Update 4/9/2020 (All Beaver County School Districts)

div.span: The Beaver County School Districts and the Career and Technology Center continue to work together as we receive guidance from our state and federal leaders. Today, Governor Wolf announced that all schools will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic year.Therefore, all Beaver County school facilities are closed and events cancelled through the end of the school year. While much uncertainty still exists, this announcement will allow families to plan for their needs in the coming months.All schools will continue to provide continuity of education and meals through at least the last regularly scheduled day of school.We understand that this is heartbreaking for the Class of 2020, but please be patient as we seek additional guidance from our state leaders regarding graduation and other special events.We appreciate your patience and support during this closure and we will continue to provide updates as we move forward together.

span.p:
Greetings.It is with aheavy heart that Ihave to officially announce the cancellation of this years Junior/Senior Prom.We had hopes that the closure would be lifted by the end of Spring break. However once the Stay-at-Home order was put in place and then extended, we had no choice. Even if we decided to postpone the event, there would not be aguarantee that we would be able to accommodate the number that we have attending. We will be in touch regarding refunds.
We realize this is not the year you were expecting. However, you being here, alive, and healthy is our primary concern.
Graduation is postponed. We are currently working on an alternate plan, but how we move forward depends on state directives.Please know that you are continually in our thoughts. Our hopes are that you and your family are healthy and safe.We will be in touch with further details regarding the remainder of the year.
Respectfully,
Miss Alexander
STRONGER TOGETHER

h3.a: Jr./Sr. High School Distance Learning Initiatives for Students

span.div: Classes at Aliquippa Jr./Sr High School are still moving ahead with learning online through Google Classroom. Students are expected to sign up to all of their regularly scheduled classes using their school email andGoogle Classroom.Click the link below for the codes to your online classes:

div.a: Classroom Codes List for Jr./Sr. High Students (PDF)

br.br:
Log into Google Classroom with your school email account to get started. Once logged in, join your classes by clicking the "+" symbol in the top right-hand corner, choosing "Join Class," and adding the class code from the list provided. Only one code can be entered at atime. If you forgot your log in information see the example below:
Student Username: first name, last initial, @goquips.org (ex: John Smith -johns@goquips.org)
Student Password: student ID, day of birth, lowercase letter "a" (ex: 12345, 4/1/2020 -1234501a)

span.div: Please contact the JSHS administration should you have any issues.
Please read the following letters fromJason Guzie,Director of Student Services:

div.span:
As we all navigate our new normal of staying at home and social distancing. Click this article for some tips to care for your physical and mental health during this difficult time. Stay safe and healthy everyone!
Jessica Judy, RN, CSN Elementary School Nurse
Lisa Pindell, RN, BSN, CSN Jr/Sr High School Nurse

h3.a: A Message from Superintendent Peter M. Carbone, Ed.D. (March 26, 2020)

span.div: Dear Aliquippa School District Community,

div.br: Earlier today, Iwas informed that another member of our school family was diagnosed with theCOVID-19 virus. The person last worked in the District on Friday, March 13, 2020. The personhas mild symptoms and is recovering while being self-quarantined.The Pennsylvania Department of Health is responsible for contact tracing. Updated informationregarding the COVID-19 virus is available on the following websites: the PennsylvaniaDepartment of Health (www.health.pa.gov) and the Center for Disease Control (www.cdc.gov).These websites update frequently regarding the COVID-19 virus. The websites have informationon how to protect yourself, if you think you are sick, symptoms, existing medical conditions,self-isolation, self-quarantining and preparing your family.
Once again, continue the following: stay calm, stay safe, and practicing social distancing.
Keep the patients and the Aliquippa community in your thoughts and prayers.

Sincerely,
Peter M. Carbone, Ed.D.
Superintendent of Schools

health services to students who are currently enrolled in Positive Steps (Wellness Center) School Based
Behavioral Health Program.

h3.a: Become a Substitute for the Aliquippa School District

span.div: Substitute positions are available for the 2019-20 school year:Bachelors Degree or PA Teachers Certificate required. Please contact Emily Eichner, Educational Recruiter, at Kelly Educational Staffing TODAY for more information. Please feel free to call 412-788-4591 Prompt 5, or email aresume to emie371@kellyservices.com.

h3.a: Aliquippa School District and Highmark Caring Place

span.div: Aliquippa School District has partnered with Highmark Caring Place, whose core purpose is to make adifference in the lives of grieving children. We will be working with the Caring Place to provide Grief Groups in grades K-12. The Groups will be held during the school day with the School Counselor at your school, will meet approximately 8-10 times over the course acouple months, and will guide your child through the grief process.

div.br: If you are interested or have questions about your child participating in this program, please contact your childs School Counselor at 724 -857- 7500.

Cassandra August grades K-6 Aliquippa Elementary School
Suzanne Goulder grades 7-9 Aliquippa Jr/Sr High School
George Bellinger grades 10-12 Aliquippa Jr/Sr High School
Please click here to view the Highmark Caring Place website.

h3.a: Notice of the Childrens Health Insurance Program (CHIP) 2019-20

span.div: CHIP covers uninsured kids and teens up to age 19. With more than 111,000 uninsured children in Pennsylvania, this is great news for families!CHIP provides quality, comprehensive health insurance for routine doctor visits, prescriptions, dental, eye care, eyeglasses, mental health, and much more. CHIP covers uninsured kids who are not eligible for Medical Assistance. For most families, CHIP is free for others, it is low cost.

div.a: Click here for more information and to enroll in CHIP.

h3.a: You aren't alone. Help is available.

span.div: Pennsylvanias bullying consultation linecan be reached at 1-866-716-0424. Experiencingabuse? Call ChildLine at 1-800-932-0313.Nervous? Talk anonymously!keepkidssafe.pa.gov

div.span: Governor Wolf signed Act 26 of 2015 into law, resulting in the creation of a new crime: Cyber Harassment of a Child (18 PA.C.S. 2709 (a.1)). Click "Read More" for more information.
